snippet: Documents said Jesse L. Jackson Jr., the former Illinois congressman, used about $750,000 in campaign funds to buy items like a Michael Jackson fedora.
abstract: Federal prosecutors file charges against former Illinois Rep Jesse L Jackson Jr, claiming he repeatedly misused about $750,000 in campaign funds while in office to buy personal luxury items and memorabilia; Jackson, who has already agreed to plead guilty to one or more charges, faces up to five years in prison and $250,000 in fines.
lead_paragraph: Documents said Jesse L. Jackson Jr., the former Illinois congressman, used about $750,000 in campaign funds to buy items like a Michael Jackson fedora.

headline.seo: Jesse Jackson Jr. Charged With Misusing Campaign Funds
headline.main: Lavish Lifestyle of a Lawmaker Yields Federal Charges
headline.print_headline:
Ex-Lawmaker Faces Charges
In Financing
Of Luxuries
